website_summaries.verdict: These locks enable you to secure items in your cupboards for an extended period of time.
pros: Can be installed without drilling, screws, magnets, or adhesives
Locks are easy to remove with one hand and can be taken on the go
Enable you to lock cabinets or drawers with a simple twist of a cap
cons: Designed for cabinets with side-by-side knobs only
May be too small for some cabinets

customer_reviews.title: The best for child proofing cabinets!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several other types of child proof locks but these are by far the best. Wish I had found them from the start! I didn’t want to drill holes in my cabinets and the stick locks were easily pulled off by my toddler. These cords totally work and my toddler can’t get the cabinets open! They may not be the prettiest but they work and that’s what matters. We have two knobs on the cabinets and we are able to pull the cords tight enough that the my don’t open enough for my son to get into trouble. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KKTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for wide set knobs
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. We installed 4 closet cabinets from home Depot at the foot of our bed. For some bizarre reason, the knobs are pre drilled into the door panel itself, not the edge of the doors, so they're about 6 inches apart, these fit perfectly with just a bit of room to spare. I'm being careful not to tighten them too much though because the hinges on these cabinets are SUPER cheap and I don't want them being pulled at by the tension of the ties. Luckily my daughter doesn't bother trying to get them off.
customer_reviews.author: Prime addict

customer_reviews.title: Easy, well designed product
customer_reviews.text: This simple design is by far the easiest way to slap safety on your cabinets. My son was over 3 by the time he figured out how to open them. And he's logical enough now to reason with about what's inside cabinets. Even though he can open them, though, he rarely feels the needs to do so as they still require some work for him (and he has strong hands). It's so nice to have found a solution that is easy and doesn't leave a bunch of broken, hanging pieces of plastic around. It's been awhile since I bought them, but I recall that they were designed by a parent and manufactured by handicapped adults. Win/win!!!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works against a 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: These are super easy to use, and hold up very well. Push the tab on the white circle to release pressure on the cord, and place it around the 2 knobs. Grasp one line of the cord and press the white circle tab again while tightening. Make sure to press the tab on the other white circle that is at the bottom of the cord and push it right up against the big white circle at the center of the cords to keep it in place. My 3 year old can't pull them off or open the cabinet doors.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great buy- make sure you install properly to prevent slippage
customer_reviews.text: So initially I didn’t read the directions of course because it seems simple enough. However, read the paper!! The cord has to be as pictured-with one end hanging very long and the other very short where the plastic pieces are touching. This is not natural for most ocd people and we would even out the strings naturally. If you do it this way it will slip and loosen when messed with and not be very effective baby proofing. When done properly it works very well with no slippage and is a great addition to our baby proofed house. Fair price. Great buy !
customer_reviews.author: A.Shop

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These have worked perfect for our cabinets in our kitchen and bathrooms. My kids see them and they don’t even try anymore because they’ve tried to open them and have had no success. The doors open slightly but not enough to fit their hands in there or get it open. These have been lifesavers. They’ve held up since I got them 2 months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best Child Cabinet Lock System
customer_reviews.text: We've tried almost every kind of child protection locks for cabinets, and these are the best for two cabinets next to each other, where you can loop the cord around two knobs. Our children cannot open them, unlike the sliding latch variety. We ordered a set three or four years ago, and they're still going strong! We ordered another set to cover some of the other cabinets. I'd definitely recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: CMick

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend for french door handles
customer_reviews.text: I have had a horrible time finding a safety lock for my french doors. Purchased these as the description states that they will fit knobs up to 7" apart. Maybe it was lack of common sense but mine are just shy of 7" so I purchased; they don't fit. I have french door handles - this will only fit KNOBS up to 7" apart. Was unable to get them around the second handle. Also could not return so I gave them to my Mother in Law as I have no other knobs that these would work on. Disappointed - shouldn't be difficult to make a lock like this with wider capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Leif

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK FOR ME.  COULD BE DANGEROUS TO CHILDREN & PETS
customer_reviews.text: I fastened on the handles as described or shown. THE PROBLEM I encountered, you can EASILY push/pull the doors open to the extent the string will allow. EASILY. Because there are buttons at the end, there is a physical limitation where they will finally stop, but at that point a head has pushed it's way through (we had on our french doors to keep dogs out of a living area) and could become a strangling hold at the neck if the animal (or child) tries and pull back or fight it. YOU CAN'T RETURN THESE ACCORDING TO THE SELLER. IN EARNEST, I CANNOT RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: These work great on closures with side by side knobs.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 precocious toddlers. Locking up cabinets is a MUST. These work great on knobs. I bought several and they're all over the house. Locking up the fireplace screen (it has doors), bookshelves lower cabinets, a China cabinet and a desk armoire. They're easy to use and I'm very happy with the purchase, fast shipping, and extra information included in the package. Now, I'd love it if I could get something as effective for my cabinets with handles. All the plastic versions are too brittle or user unfriendly for our busy home.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Simple solution, no damage
customer_reviews.text: It's working perfectly for my 20-month-old so far. I was looking for a solution for the cabinets that doesn't involve big sticky squares that leave residue all over the place. Granted, she loses interest fairly quickly, but with the double "lock" on the strings, I don't think she could figure out quite yet how to pull them apart if her little fingers even had the strength to push them. Overall, quick, simple, damage-free solution for nosy toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Wessler

customer_reviews.title: ... had these a few days but so far I love them! I tried originally going with those magnetic ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had these a few days but so far I love them! I tried originally going with those magnetic locks but if you’ve got kids like I do that just like to talk on the cabinets to see how hard they can pull to get them open those things don’t last very long. These cord wraps are amazing! My son tried a couple of times but now doesn’t even bother trying. I was able to use them in the bathroom and on the entertainment centers!
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Powell

customer_reviews.title: stops the cat
customer_reviews.text: We have 6 cats in the house. One has earned the name Wreck-it Ruth. Her goal in life is to open doors and drawers, and if things look good, she then rearranges them (Emptied a sock drawer out onto the floor) (Shredded TP in the bathroom, it looked like it had snowed), Anyway this cord is helping with one of our bedside tables she keeps opening and exploring. I never had to lock anything when I had kids many years ago, but now with this group childproofing has taken on a new meaning.
customer_reviews.author: Tank

customer_reviews.title: Rope quality is poor and exterior comes apart
customer_reviews.text: These work mainly for cabinets where the handles are closer together. They will not work for French doors since the handles are too far apart. You would have to use two if you want to use it for double doors. The material is made of a fiber that gets tugged, pulled, and stretched from the plastic stopper. Over time, the fibers stick out making it impossible for the rope to slide through the device. I can tell it is made of cheap material. After using it for the first time, we can already see the rope exterior come apart. The slide got stuck. I think overall the quality really is poor. We ended up returning it the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Peppa Unboxing

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product! Very easy to use. I bought them because my puppy kept getting into my office to get into trouble. The office has French doors that push open with no real locking mechanism. He would just nudge the door open. The only suggestion that I would make is that it would be nice to have some variety of lengths available. I tied two of the Kiscords together to reach around the French door handles. One longer one would be great! I’m sure that there are applications for shorter ones as well. Outside of that product choice suggestion, I would say EXCELLENT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Martha Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade your childproofing of lower cabinets with this value bundle.
customer_reviews.text: What an outstanding product! I purchased the 5-pack and used on lower cabinets in my bathrooms and in my kitchen. These are so much easier to use than the traditional plastic long u-shaped bar which slides around the handles and has to be released from a plastic restraint. With this product, you simply push in the center restraint button to move the apparatus to release the "kiscords" or to tighten them to "lock" the cabinets. I use these when my toddler-age grandson arrives for a visit and my home is child-proofed in a flash. The 5-pack was also a great value. I highly recommend the product and the seller - great experience and no worries!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: -These are super easy to use, but you should definitely read the instructions real quick before using it so that you get the most effective security. -They don't make that annoying loud click that so many locks do and won't break from a rogue yank. -There is no installation, which is nice for renters and for people who aren't handy. Also, you won't have to uninstall it when the kids grow up. -I don't have kids in the house, but these keep my pets out of cabinets containing cleaning supplies, roach baits, etc. My pets don't really play with strings, but I can see this item doubling as a toy for someone's more playful pet. Haha.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: They work on french doors!
customer_reviews.text: My kids keep going into my office that's through french doors and messing everything up. It's driving me nuts! I've tried everything - ponytails on the doors, bungee cords, doorstops. Nothing worked until I found these. I was hesitant buying them as I figured they would't work, but they do! If you're having the same problem, buy these. They keep my blood pressure from rising a few times less a day...priceless!
customer_reviews.author: MrsBenson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These have been a life saver at our house. Previously tried the type where one part needed to be screwed into the actual cabinets themselves. With the kiscords, nothing permanent has to be done to the cabinets and also child proofs at the same time. The only thing though, would be that you have to remember to resecure them after each closing of the cabinet as they aren't automatic as the other types.
customer_reviews.author: tmn

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: This gets almost full stars because I haven't found another product that will work in any way for what we needed it for. I needed some kind of lock for our kitchen pantry. It's a large, double door closet type pantry. My hulk toddler broke one of the "locks" at the top of the doors, but it was only a matter of time anyway. These work, but I have to use two because one isn't long enough. For about a month now, it's worked though, so I can't complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: I know that aesthetically they aren't pretty but THEY WORK
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had found these before we installed al those plastic clips that required us to drill holes in our cabinets that ultimately either broke or my toddler figured out how to manipulate. I know that aesthetically they aren't pretty but THEY WORK!! They also won't damage cabinets so if you are in a rental situation they are perfect for you!! The quality is reflected in the price.
customer_reviews.author: GaGinger

customer_reviews.title: Great with pets
customer_reviews.text: Great! Use to keep dogs out of kitchen garbage cabinet. Cord had just enough stretch that you can pick a snug setting and just slip it around knobs without really having to move the locking mechanism. Haven't had to pick up garbage since we trotted these. Tried plastic locks before this and dogs could break them or they were a hassle to open and close repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler proofing
customer_reviews.text: This are great! They are soft ropes so no scratching cabinets or hurting hardware. The slider is hard for my 6 yo to use so we leave them slightly looser and she can just slip them off; the rope has a slight stretch. Even slightly loose my toddler can't get them off or the doors open and my husband can easily get in and out of the cabinets (when they were tight and he had to slide them loose he complained).
customer_reviews.author: Chevheav

customer_reviews.title: Very practical and easy to use ! But order Black!
customer_reviews.text: Easy product to use perfect for people who don’t want to mess around with drilling or sticky tape on their cabinets. My destructive kiddo hasn’t been able to break into them yet ! The only thing I recommend even for white kitchens is to get the black ones bc the white ones obviously getting dirty fast and you think well if you make sure your hands are clean before touching them that wouldn’t happen however in real life your toddler that your trying to prevent getting into the cabinets may have dirty hands from idk being a toddler .
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Christlieb

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation!
customer_reviews.text: We actually bought these to keep our cats from opening our closet doors, and I must say they work great for our fur babies. I’m quite certain they would work for human babies as well. Our fur babies are quite resourceful when it comes to opening doors, and they haven’t figured out what the problem is. It will be so nice not to have white cat hair all over everything from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly St. John Cantwell

customer_reviews.title: My cat/dog team still get in the locked cabinet!
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased hoping to discourage the dog's gorging on her dry food. But it was folly. Although It's never when we're around so I can't imagine how the lock ties are unlocked but they are - three times now! So they either work as a cat/dog team or my sweet WheatyPoo is a marvel. Looked like it could be a solution but alas, it was /is not. Probably a good solution for small human hands in that the buttons are fairly hard to depress.
customer_reviews.author: 4 Design

customer_reviews.title: A Cabinet Safety Lock That is Toddler Proof, But Not Grandma Proof!
customer_reviews.text: As I follow a busy toddler around, I need something that goes before me to help protect her from her explorations. I am so impressed with these cabinet safety locks! It does not defeat me from getting into my cabinets, or cause me to go into 3D puzzle solving mode. What a terrific concept, and one that works! I wish all of my cabinets had knobs, so I could use this for all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Teaching&Learning

customer_reviews.title: A word of caution....
customer_reviews.text: If you intend to use these on lower cabinets they are like a magnet for toddler in walker. The toddler wants to pull on ropes and put the ball end in mouth. I used these just the same and discouraged the behavior. Also tried tucking them within, I like that I didn't have to alter cabinets with screw in devices as I am grandmother babysitting but if my toddler lived in house I would recommend another device.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: If 4.5 stars were possible I'd have given it -- these are great
customer_reviews.text: We have a large floor-to-ceiling cabinet that we really need our toddler not to be able to get into. These fit neatly over the knobs and have completely stymied him; it will be a while before he figures it out. We frankly wish we had more cabinets or other things in our home we could use these on -- they are easy to use and reasonably nice looking. (It's great that you have some color options.) I gave 4 stars because the string is not of the highest possible quality, but at 5 of these for $10 the value makes up for it. I'd give 4.5 stars if that were possible.
customer_reviews.author: meyerlane

customer_reviews.title: Not as large as shown in the pictures and they don't allow returns.
customer_reviews.text: They're easy to install when you can actually use them. We have some cabinets with handles less than 6 inches apart and these won't work there. Also if the handles are larger than just a knob they won't fit around the two handles. The pictures makes them look like they will work on larger gaps or doors with larger handles but alas, they don't. And when we tried to return the item it says, "this item is not eligible for a return." You're better off to find a product from a company that guarantees it's product will work for you instead of this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Detizo

customer_reviews.title: Nope!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I should’ve watched videos on these prior to buying. I wrongly assumed they would prevent cabinets from being opened at all. Instead it simply prevents them from being opened very much. However a child can open them enough to shove their tiny hands in and get hurt. Horrible design in my opinion. Also buyer beware it appears they can’t be returned!
customer_reviews.author: Leanna

customer_reviews.title: Works great for keeping doors shut...even from cats
customer_reviews.text: Yes...I have child locks on the cabinets to keep the cat's out. (And it does the job.) My curious cats liked to go through cupboards and crawl behind the sink/eat plastics in the drawers etc so I needed a "child proof" way to keep them out. This kind of cabinet lock works for doors with the two side-by-side knobs, and round knobs work the best. The cord goes around the two knobs on the outside and uses a button to tighten and release the cords. Anyone can figure out how to use these, but not your cat :)
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Valuso

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for french closet doors!
customer_reviews.text: I have so many french closet doors in my house and my kids love to get into them and literally rip everything out and scatter it all. These are so easy to just put on the door, tighten them and my toddlers haven't been able to figure them out. No hardware, just simple string mechanism, this child proof product has made such a difference, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: abbottclan

customer_reviews.title: These don't look that great but I like not having to drill holes or ...
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness these arrived in time! I was fed up with our toddler getting into cabinets and our office that has French doors. These don't look that great but I like not having to drill holes or worrying about damaging the surfaces. I tied two locks together on the French doors as one alone was a very tight squeeze. So far my toddler hasn't figured out how to break these so I am one happy mama!
customer_reviews.author: N+B

customer_reviews.title: Works well but you can't undo it with one hand
customer_reviews.text: I really like these on our French doors and our closet doors. My autistic son is now strong enough to manhandle the plastic guards we'd used for years but so far, he can't manage to outwit these. He'll probably figure it out eventually but it works for now. BUT, they are not being accurate that you can undo them with one hand. I've tried many times over the past few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for no instillation baby proofing!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for keeping our daughter out of the cabinets without having to install anything. We have been using them for about six months now and she hasn't been able to get them off. They do not slip loose or anything so I have felt safe about letting her play with them as they hang. I highly recommend these as a baby proof solution!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Very effective and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: The babies I am using these cords to keep out of closets are fur babies. I am grateful they don't have opposable thumbs because they are too smart and open doors all over the house. There are unsafe materials in the closets they lap and chew. Kiscords work exceptionally well at preventing them from entering the closets, but open very easily with one hand when needed. I am very pleased with them and wish I had found them years ago - I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JenG

customer_reviews.title: Work like a charm
customer_reviews.text: They're so easy to put on or take off. Our almost 9-month old hasn't started opening cupboards yet (just scoots all around the floor so far), BUT my friend's 1-yr old always tries to open my kitchen cabinets, and these stopped him! Was only able to put on the double-door cabinets, but those usually have the liquids or big stuff, so I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Delci

customer_reviews.title: Works for French Doors
customer_reviews.text: This child lock is perfect for locking my french doors. I had another type of plastic lock that my child could still push open, but this safety cord fits right over my round door handles. I put the cord around each handle, twist the cord in the middle and then pull tight. My 4 year old isn't able to get the cord off or the doors open.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Check the length you need first
customer_reviews.text: The cords are just not long enough. They are fine for certain knobs and handles but just not mine. I have not been able to find a product to secure my doors and I have five sets. So i didn't realize I hadn't posted this. We are at least a month later. One of the cords...the one most used is starting to fray and jam. So while i love these i suspect a new model will be out soon
customer_reviews.author: Edward Smith

customer_reviews.title: So very simple yet so effective! Genius!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to see if it would work to deter my grandson from raiding my cabinets when I'm not looking! I am very happy with my purchase of these cabinet locks. I was delighted that I didn’t have to drill into my beautiful cabinets or damage the finish with adhesive. I was able to childproof our kitchen in a matter of minutes without measuring anything. Also, my grandson has not been able to figure them out. I will surely be ordering more for my whole kitchen and it will definitely be my new go-to gift for baby showers! Thanks, Kiscords!
customer_reviews.author: terriolinda

customer_reviews.title: Useful to prevent toddlers from opening cabinets with knobs
customer_reviews.text: The product is useful, it tightens the knobs to 85-90% but then a little gap is expected. Ofcourse the toddler cant access whats inside the cabinet anymore. This is a good product but I think it can be priced better. It only has 5 safety straps which is pricey for its cost. I would expect atleast 10 straps at this cost.
customer_reviews.author: Ashutosh Pradhan

customer_reviews.title: Works for our unusual cabinets
customer_reviews.text: These corded childproof locks work great because the traditional bar locks that go around the knobs were too wide for our knobs and slid right off. These corded locks fit right around our knobs. We haven't put them to the test with our inquisitive grandson yet, but I think they will work well at keeping him out of the cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: I needed to childproof a couple of cabinets. The stores have nothing that fits from knob to knob. This product does the trick! It’s so easy for grown ups to put on and take off! My only complaint is that my grandson likes to play with the part that hangs down. I fixed the problem by wrapping the Entire cord around the knobs. I can now let my grandson play in only the “safe” cupboards
customer_reviews.author: Lainey

customer_reviews.title: Like Fort Knox when you get them on!
customer_reviews.text: I really bought a bunch of options for cabinet locks and this one is the Best Buy leaps and bounds! This is so basic and works so well I feel like it’s a joke still - the small rope locks in nice and the kids can’t get the doors open. They are a touch annoying, but not as bad as when my kids take out all the pots and pans and get all crazy town with them!
customer_reviews.author: AMM

customer_reviews.title: Fit knobs Farther apart also great for French doors kitty tested and approved much to her dismay
customer_reviews.text: Omg these were perfect for us, we have French doors for our bedroom that don't lock and open very easily we needed a way to lock our cats in or out so it had to be tight enough to keep the doors together even if she pushed it open it was difficult to find something to work but it's been perfect and shortly after these arrived she started opening a kitsch cupboard and the extras worked great to nip that in the bud lol, no more problems with her since we've gotten them sorry no advice for it working with human kids
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for grandparents, unattractive for 24/7 use
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for a grandparent that doesn't need protection all the time. It would be inconvenient and unattractive for the parents. Some people say the child figures them out easily, that seems very likely. It is possible to put the tie on backwards so that the button is hidden which might help. Generally I would say if the child is always there, get a different product. My grandson is not walking, so I am not a good judge of how well they work by the time you really need them.They are inexpensive and easily replaced at that time though.
customer_reviews.author: Magill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Have not had them for very long so I do not know how long they will last, but I will say I am happy I didn’t have to drill into my cabinets, and they work amazing! My only complaint is I wish they were not white because they get dirty fast, maybe I didn’t see color option but it’s not a big deal to take away from how well the product works!
customer_reviews.author: Paul lore

customer_reviews.title: Cirque de Kitty: Not Safe for Work
customer_reviews.text: I have spent years trying to keep French doors that open in to my home office secure from my cats who insist on being visible and vocal coworkers. As much as I love having my meows on my lap during long conference calls, they are not often camera ready and cat around when I am hosting video conference calls. I have tied cable, string, rubber bands, hair ties and cords around the door to keep them out, nothing was effective until I found Kiscords which are easy effective, can be used with one hand, and definitely feline proof.
customer_reviews.author: isc98118

customer_reviews.title: Easy, affordable & keeps kids out!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this child locks, so far only thing my baby can’t figure out to get open on his own. East to put up, and take on and off. Love the look much better than other locks, and doesn’t leave anything behind when you’re finished with them, especially import if you don’t own your home. Great price as well. Blends in great with our white cabinetry.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Gatewood

customer_reviews.title: Great for Curious Cats
customer_reviews.text: I don't have children, but I do have a cat who likes to open cabinets, including the one under the sink where I keep cleaners, etc. I needed something that would keep her from climbing inside but was easy enough to remove that I could access the cabinet. This is perfect. It's simple enough to take off when I need to, but definitely something that my cat can't pull off or knock off.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Simple & Easy to Use, Probably Better for Smaller Kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product if you cannot use the traditional loop locks on your door handles/knobs. However, my three year old has the grip strength of a merchant marine, and is able to loosen them & pull them off the handles very easily. These would be a great buy if you have a 1-2 year old, or if your older child (3-4) isn't freakishly strong like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great keeping our cats out of closets
customer_reviews.text: This is the only product I have found, including 5 lb hand weights, that keep our Tonkineese cats from opening doors. I’m able to now keep our linen closet straight and can use this devise one handed when I have one arm ho,ding clean linens to put away-it’s not an issue. Also, because our doors are white, you bate,y notice this device, it’s got a pretty low profile considering other options out there. This has saved us a lot of headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but didn't work for us
customer_reviews.text: I am searching for a product that will lock our double door closets. Our toddler twin boys have destroyed their closet more than I'd like to admit! Unfortunately this product for not work for us. It is nicely built and would be very secure. They advertise will fit knobs 6.5 inch apart. Our handles were around 5 but I guess it's getting the cord over and around the actual handle that was the problem for us. Like I said looks like a great product, just didn't work like we thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: M&K Wermert

customer_reviews.title: Why put holes in your cabinets?
customer_reviews.text: Unless you don't have handles adjacent to each other, I don't know why one would put holes in their cabinets to keep the doors closed to toddlers. This product is perfect and VERY INEXPENSIVE but the quality is not cheap. Rope and plastic parts are solid. My sister stole a few of mine and so I had to replace!
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix7!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: They seem to work great and are easy to use. The only drawback is the dangling cord is a distraction to my toddler. She loves to play with it. But on the bright side she's playing with the cord and not the stuff in my cabinet. I gave a one-star on adhesion because it does not apply to this product.
customer_reviews.author: dearl

customer_reviews.title: Much better than usual cupboard door products
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for use while grand babies are visiting from out of town. I didn't want to install the devices that have to be screwed in and a hassle to open doors with. These fit the bill. They are a little difficult to remove, but not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Queen

customer_reviews.title: Best safety Cabinet Locks
customer_reviews.text: These are the easiest and best safety locks for cabinets with handles! I was looking for something that would keep out a toddler but not make us adults crazy. I bought so many different kinds of safety lock, but these are absolutely the best. Easy for adults to use. Impossible for toddlers. Perfect.No assembly, no screws or glue. Just take them out and wrap them around your cabinet handles and presto. Safe. I have also bought these for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Smile

customer_reviews.title: Good for Grammy's visit
customer_reviews.text: I would not use these as a long term safety feature. They do stretch enough for doors to open and can catch little fingers inside the doors. My knobs are only 5 inches apart on center. The gap I speak of when the tie is as tight as possible pulls open 1 and a half inches from the cabinet. My Grandson was perplexed because this was new to him, but Grammy taught him where the "fun cabinet" was. We have a kitchen band formed now - just like when I was a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Jubee

customer_reviews.title: Great option for quick childproofing!
customer_reviews.text: Hosting little ones, but don’t want to permanently install cabinet locks? These work great (if you have the right style cabinet pulls). Worked great for our 28 month old grandson. He tried the first day, then stopped pulling. Glad we ordered several five packs, as we had more cabinets to secure than I’d realized.
customer_reviews.author: GloryGirl

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 orders (6 total) of these cabinet lock latches and received them within two days, days earlier than estimated by Amazon. I paid only one shipping charge for the entire order, which was mailed efficiently in an envelope. These are a simple drawstring-type mechanism that work well to prevent my 14-month-old from opening cabinets. For those of you with preschoolers, my nearly 4-year-old can undo the latch, but it slows him down. (I bought them to deter my younger son.) Great product.
customer_reviews.author: A. R. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this product fast and it works like a charm. My son can get into almost anything and this product has really made my day a lot easier! I no longer have to tape cabinet doors together only to have him persistently pull at it and eventually unravel it. Now I can get into my cabinets easy and my children doesn't even bother trying to get into those cabinets anymore. It was incredibly inexpensive and works so well. I will recommend this to everyone that will listen.
customer_reviews.author: Lene B.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what we were looking for. My wife's home office has French doors with knobs. We tried a couple other products to keep our little adventurers out, but they were either too short (the sideways "U" lock) or they broke (the cabinet lock with zipties). This lock is simple and easy to move from inside to out. Plus, the price point can't be beaten. Wish we had found them earlier, would have saved us a lot of time and headache.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Works great and keeps the baby out.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find any other cabnet handle locks that would work for the multiple styles installed and these work great I was even able to install one on my coffee table the keep the baby out from scattering the movie collection all across the floor. They are also a stretchy enuff to pull off by an adult and slip it back on for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: Blair N.

customer_reviews.title: Under sink doors open about an inch
customer_reviews.text: I installed them according to the instructions. I then had my 16 month old grandson try to open the doors. for upper cabinets (Like the one pictured) it worked fine. For under the sink cabinets, the doors opened about an inch which was too much for my liking. In my case I have a 3.5 inch space between the two doors and thats why I believe they opened so much.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesman

customer_reviews.title: Great Device.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an option that was easy to install, easy to remove, and did not damage the cabinet or leave behind and sticky residue. This product checked all the boxes and currently does an excellent job of preventing my little one from opening the cabinet doors.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! These work equally well on several cabinets with differently-spaced knobs. Our kids and cats managed to get into the previous locks, and they also weren't working well unless the knobs were spaced just so. So far, these are doing the trick - nobody's getting into them, and they don't require us to use two hands to get the cupboard open.
customer_reviews.author: MaineMama

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a one year old teether. He forgets he’s trying to get in a cabinet because he gets distracted by putting it in his mouth and biting on it. So he stops tugging on the cabinets. Very durable and hasn’t fallen apart.
customer_reviews.author: Nakisha Horne

customer_reviews.title: are incredibly easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Thank GOD! Finally a childproofing product that is simple but extremely effective! My friend told me about these and that they were the only chilproofing that seemed to work in her house. I had been trying to find something that would work with our cabinet pulls - which are NOT unusual or oddly shaped! The plastic slide style ones didn't fit behind the pull, and therefore didn't work properly. These fit perfectly, are incredibly easy to use, and my son can't get into the soaps and such under the kitchen sink. What more can a toddler mom ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Julie Anne

customer_reviews.title: Easier than those "other" cabinet latches!
customer_reviews.text: These cabinet latches are an excellent idea and better alternative to the ones you have to install with screws. Our granddaughter noticed them as soon as we put them on, but since she could no longer open the cabinets, she doesn't bother with them anymore! What a great idea!
customer_reviews.author: BelieverInJesus

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Mentally Challenged Sister
customer_reviews.text: My sister is mentally challenged and she tends to eat without a sensor. . . we got these in hopes that it would help her think twice before she gets seconds, thirds, etc. It gives her a little extra time to think about what she's getting in to and if she should or shouldn't be in there. She can get into it - I can do it one handed, but it does what we wanted it to. Received the product just as promised and works as described.
customer_reviews.author: L Capshaw

customer_reviews.title: No more broken dishes or dangerous findings
customer_reviews.text: These locks are super easy to install & keep my 15 month old out of my cabinets. I have some cabinets dedicated to her use. Well worth my money. The Grandparents are asking for these but make sure you have the right handles
customer_reviews.author: 1st Klaz

customer_reviews.title: Extremely simple to install and they work great.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. We have some weird handles on our cabinets, and they work perfectly! They are very fast to open and close, and impossible for the littlest to do. Our 6 year old has no problem opening them, but her little brother (15 months) is stymied by this technology!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Note to Seller...
customer_reviews.text: I've been SO looking forward to buying and using these. They would've been perfect, but our knobs are 9 inches apart and they only work for 6 inches apart. Any chance you guys could make some that are longer? Didn't work for my needs, but they seem nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Davis

customer_reviews.title: So simple yet so effective
customer_reviews.text: I got a lot of different baby proofing items and found the design of my cabinets was terrible for the typical plastic hook stopper things. This string is so simple and has been the most effective of the items I got! Plus being the easiest to install and remove and not being so ugly. Baby-proofing tools are not universal. It all depends on how your cabinets (or whatever it is you are baby-proofing) are designed. This is great for the knobs.
customer_reviews.author: littlefoot

customer_reviews.title: Best baby proofing item
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and they work great. It's always nice to find a baby proofing item that doesn't require installation. These just slip on. Love this product and will recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: T. Awad

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 yr old and almost a 4 yr old and I just needed something that requires no drilling or screwing. This does the job. They don’t open drawers that much anyway but this gives peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Simply solution for keeping double cabinet doors closed!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an easy childproof solution for double cabinet doors, this is your choice! I’ve got an obsessed two year old who loves to open cabinets! For my sanity and his safety...,these are a lifesaver!! So easy to install and even easier to open for easy access to cabinets for adults!!
customer_reviews.author: PKT

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick with no damage to wood or paint
customer_reviews.text: They’re basic, to say the least. I wish I had thought of something so simple on my own. With that being said, we have wasted a lot of time and money on other products (magnets that break, plastic that scratches the paint off of cabinets, etc), and these actually work perfectly. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This lock for knobs was easy to both put on and remove when needed. I had tried other locks for knobs and they were difficult to use for an adult. One came with instructions that I had to post so I could remove it. This is a short small cord (no risk of child becoming entangled) cinching device. So pleased I found it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These cords work perfectly on my kitchen cabinets. The knobs are far apart and I was havung trouble trying to find a no hardware solution. I had some other ones on there that were very difficult to put on and take off. These are so easy! While I do need two hands to tighten the cord I can easily remove them with one hand. My toddler can still open the cabinets some but not any wider than with the previous set up. I am so glad I gound these!
customer_reviews.author: MamaD

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a second set of these since they were easy to use especially for my 8 year old. It keeps cabinets close when baby tries to go into things he shouldn’t but easy to unlock for the entire family.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper28

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use solution
customer_reviews.text: I needed a safety device to keep a toddler out of the art supplies for my older grandchildren. The cabinets are low so all could open the doors. This simple safety latch works well. It is easy for my old hands to manipulate, but not easy enough for a 2yo.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great keeper-outer
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my twin toddler girls who are now into everything. These cords work great and I can usually unhook them with one hand. Only drawback is that the white gets dirty easily.
customer_reviews.author: I'm an Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! Right before I found this I was using a white thick string around two door knobs and my toddler some how untangled it so this works perfect because he hasn't figured out how to undo this! Highly recommend for anyone with small children or pets?! Also other products are sometimes too short to reach certain lengths between door knobs this was the length I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy and effective
customer_reviews.text: These are really easy to use on cabinet knobs! They will not work on handles though because they don't open. I like these so much better than the Safety First ones that you have to press a button to unlock.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Cline

customer_reviews.title: Multi use safety cords are great
customer_reviews.text: These locks are clearly great for uses other than for baby proofing. We have a cat who loves to pull open the garbage cabinet so are using them to tightly secure the cabinet. I can pull it nice and tight and then it’s easy to loosen to open when I need to. And the five pack is great.
customer_reviews.author: ajax

customer_reviews.title: Even better than I hoped
customer_reviews.text: The little bit of stretch in these, made it easier to fit onto my different sized cabinets. (I did measure before buying, and I knew it would be close.) These are so easy to put on. They are easy to take off, also, but I wouldn't want to have to take them off over & over everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Shenanigan

customer_reviews.title: Definitely try these! They work well.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these over the hard plastic type. There more discreet and easier for adult hands to use. My 22 month old grandson has not figured out how to open these and because these are more discreet he doesn’t really try. He continues to try to open the hard plastic type and I’m afraid he will. Get these instead!
customer_reviews.author: Susan F.

customer_reviews.title: Effective and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: If you have a toddler that likes to open pantries, cupboards, and cabinets, GET THESE. Obviously you will need something to hook these on to, but they adjust easily, and my trickster 2yr old hasnt figured them out.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly H

customer_reviews.title: Low profile baby proofing solution
customer_reviews.text: Great solution for cabinets with pulls instead of handles! But if you need the handle kind, this company has you covered, too. I also love the look of these, as the typical baby proofing stuff is so plasticky and awful looking. And these are easy to remove when you're done...
customer_reviews.author: V. Tkachuk

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for adults yet keep our toddler grandchildren out of our cabinets. Love that there is no drilling. Nothing permanent. I throw them in a drawer when the kids leave n pull them out when I know they are coming for a visit.
customer_reviews.author: Brown dog

customer_reviews.title: a must have!
customer_reviews.text: My husband refused to drill into our new kitchen cabinets and after trying other devices (which I REALLY could not open) I read the reviews and settled on this. Shipping was fast and they are just great! Easy to operate (for us not the little ones), can be opned with one hand while holding baby, and provides a little distraction to baby with the string and tassle....takes his mind off getting into the cabinet!
customer_reviews.author: Mali

customer_reviews.title: So simple, but effective
customer_reviews.text: We actually bought these not to baby proof for our 7 month old, but to keep our 3 year old out of the entertainment center. I’m worried he’ll be able to figure out how to open it, but hopefully it’ll deter him long enough that we can catch him and redirect before electronics are broken!
customer_reviews.author: W. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I got these to keep my toddler it off the cabinets. They are a bit smaller than expected. I thought they would be a slight bit bigger to fit a wider gap in handles. Other than that, they are good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lingling

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, sturdy material, those little ones won't be opening those cabinets again!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, sturdy material, those little ones won't be opening those cabinets again! Very simple but useful idea, created by a mom whom probably suffered from the same pain than you and me: Little ones opening cabinets ALL the time. They won't do it again!
customer_reviews.author: CJ24Ventura

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: You get multiple cabinet locks for the price which is a great help. They're easy to operate designwise they are made of a material which doesn't seem to wear quickly so the longevity of the product is a HUGE benefit. Easy to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work great and are super easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these cabinet locks because I really like that these are a soft cord that won’t scratch my cabinets. I’ve been using them for a few days now and they work great and they’re super easy to use! My 1 1/2 year old granddaughter noticed them on my cabinets and she touched them out of curiosity but certainly can’t get them open. I’m very happy with my purchase so far!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy Fix!
customer_reviews.text: These work great. They are child proof, but adults are able to remove easily. I like the fact that they will not rub or harm my wood cabinets. This was a great option as the other brands and options I tried did not work well for me. My one year old likes to play with the string, but then leaves my cabinets alone! Nice, quick, easy fix!
customer_reviews.author: Laura B

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: it opens no matter what you do. Not totally, just enough for your kids to put their hands in and then shut their fingers and hurt them. or grab the things i want to protect them from. Please think about the design.
customer_reviews.author: sunny

product_meta.title: Kiscords Baby Safety Cabinet Locks for Knobs Child Safety Cabinet Latches for Home Safety Strap for Baby Proofing Cabinets Kitchen Door RV No Drill No Screw No Adhesive (White)
feature_bullets: THIS 5-PACK OF CHILD SAFETY CABINET LOCKS ARE DESIGNED TO WORK ONLY ON CABINETS WITH SIDE-BY-SIDE KNOBS. Have handles? See our other product designed specifically for straight handles by scrolling to the bottom of this listing.

KEEP YOUR BABY SAFE FROM ACCIDENTS: This baby cabinet latch offers the best protection to keep your kids safe without damage to your expensive cupboards. They are perfect for child proofing kitchens, bathrooms and furniture.

NO DRILLING, NO ADHESIVE: Our cabinet straps are easy to install without drilling, screws, magnets or adhesives. They are perfect to childproof your home without damaging your cupboards. They easily adjust to secure knobs up to 6 ½ inches apart on center.

EASY FOR ADULTS---NOT CHILDREN: kids can't open these fasteners, but parents will love the simplicity…the cords are easy to remove with just one hand and are portable so they can be taken anywhere to keep your toddler safe.
PORTABLE…Small size and easy installation make these safety locks perfect for on the go parents.
